Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your comfort food game with a delightful twist on a classic? This Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese sandwich combines the gooey goodness of melted cheddar cheese with the savory, sweet richness of bacon jam, all tucked between perfectly toasted slices of sourdough bread. Whether you're looking for a quick lunch, a delicious snack, or a show-stopping party appetizer, this recipe will tick all the boxes. The balance of flavors in this sandwich is simply irresistible, making it a must-try for any cheese lover or bacon aficionado. Plus, with just a few simple ingredients and easy cooking steps, you’ll be enjoying this delectable creation in no time. Let’s dive into the world of gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches and discover how you can make this Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese that’s sure to impress!

Ingredients

bread (sourdough or your choice)

Sourdough adds a wonderful tangy flavor and chewy texture, but feel free to substitute with whole grain, white, or even gluten-free bread if needed. For better crispness, let the bread sit out for a bit to dry slightly before grilling.

cheddar cheese

Cheddar is a classic choice for grilled cheese, offering a sharp flavor that pairs well with bacon jam. You can substitute with other types of cheese like Gruyère for a nutty taste, or mozzarella for a meltier texture. Consider using a mix of cheeses for a more complex flavor.

bacon jam

Bacon jam adds a sweet and savory element to the sandwich. If you don't have bacon jam, you can make your own by cooking down bacon with onions, brown sugar, and vinegar. Alternatively, try using a store-bought caramelized onion spread or a savory chutney for a similar effect.

butter

Butter is essential for achieving that golden, crispy crust. For a richer flavor, use unsalted butter. If you're looking for a healthier option, you can substitute with olive oil or vegan butter. For added flavor, consider mixing in a little garlic powder or herbs into the butter before spreading.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients

    Gather all your ingredients: 2 slices of sourdough bread, 2 slices of cheddar cheese, 2 tablespoons of bacon jam, and 1 tablespoon of butter. Make sure everything is at room temperature for even cooking.

  • Step 2: Butter the Bread

    Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread generously. This will help achieve a golden, crispy texture. Expert Tip: Use room temperature butter for easier spreading and to avoid tearing the bread.

  • Step 3: Spread the Bacon Jam

    On the non-buttered side of one slice of bread, spread the bacon jam evenly. Make sure to cover the entire surface to maximize flavor in every bite. Note: If you like a stronger bacon flavor, feel free to add more jam.

  • Step 4: Add the Cheese

    Place the slices of cheddar cheese on top of the bacon jam. This will melt beautifully and complement the sweetness of the jam. Tip: For added flavor, mix different cheeses like Gruyère or Monterey Jack with the cheddar.

  • Step 5: Assemble the Sandwich

    Top with the second slice of bread, ensuring the buttered side is facing out. This will create a nice crust once cooked.

  • Step 6: Heat the Skillet

    Preheat a skillet over medium heat. It’s important to get the skillet hot enough to toast the bread but not so hot that it burns before the cheese melts.

  • Step 7: Cook the Sandwich

    Place the sandwich in the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes until the bottom is golden brown. Carefully flip the sandwich and cook for another 3-5 minutes until the other side is golden and the cheese is melted. Expert Tip: If the bread is browning too quickly, lower the heat to allow the cheese to melt thoroughly without burning the bread.

  • Step 8: Serve and Enjoy

    Once cooked, remove the sandwich from the skillet and let it cool for a minute. Cut it in half diagonally for a nice presentation. Serve immediately while the cheese is still gooey!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the bread for grilling?

To prepare the bread, simply spread butter evenly on one side of each slice. This helps achieve a golden, crispy crust when grilled.

What type of cheese should I use for a grilled cheese sandwich?

Cheddar is a great choice for flavor and meltiness, but feel free to mix it with other cheeses like mozzarella or gouda for different flavors!

How do I know when my grilled cheese is done?

Look for a golden brown color on both sides of the bread and check if the cheese is melted. If you're unsure, a little peek can help!

What should I do if my sandwich is browning too quickly?

If your sandwich is browning too fast, reduce the heat to low. This allows the bread to toast evenly while giving the cheese time to melt.

Is it safe to cook bacon jam?

Yes! Bacon jam is usually cooked during its preparation. Just ensure it's warmed through before spreading it on your sandwich.

Can I make my grilled cheese in advance?

While grilled cheese is best fresh, you can prepare the components ahead of time. Just assemble the sandwich when ready to cook!

What are some variations I can try with grilled cheese?

You can add ingredients like sliced tomatoes, avocado, or even different spreads like pesto for a unique twist on your grilled cheese!

How do I clean my skillet after cooking?

Allow the skillet to cool, then wipe it down with a paper towel. If there are stuck bits, soak it with warm soapy water before scrubbing gently.

What if I don’t have bacon jam?

If you don’t have bacon jam, try using regular bacon, or substitute with a sweet and savory jam like fig or onion jam for similar flavor.

Why is butter important in this recipe?

Butter not only adds flavor but helps to create a crispy, golden crust on the bread when grilled!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a vegetarian version, substitute bacon jam with a mushroom or onion jam to maintain a savory profile. Use vegan butter and cheese alternatives to make the dish completely plant-based. Gluten-free bread can be used for a gluten-free option, ensuring that all dietary preferences are accommodated while still enjoying the delicious flavor profile.

Pairings

Pair the Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese with a side of tangy pickles or a fresh arugula salad, dressed with a light vinaigrette to balance the richness. For beverages, consider serving a crisp apple cider or a light-bodied pale ale to complement the smoky flavors of the bacon jam. A side of tomato soup can also enhance the experience, providing a classic contrast to the sandwich.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Bacon Jam Grilled Cheese warm, cut diagonally to showcase the gooey cheese and rich jam. For an elevated presentation, sprinkle freshly chopped herbs like chives or parsley on top. Consider placing the sandwich on a wooden board with small bowls of dipping sauces such as spicy mustard or a balsamic reduction for an interactive experience. Adding a small side of crispy sweet potato fries can make for a heartier meal.

Description

A savory twist on the classic grilled cheese, featuring crispy bacon jam and gooey melted cheese.

Ingredients

  • bread (sourdough or your choice): 2 slices
  • cheddar cheese: 2 slices
  • bacon jam: 2 tablespoons
  • butter: 1 tablespoon
